appearances.snippet: it's congresswoman ann wagner.ion is to, "play an extra in a 'stranger things' spinoff without changing her hair or outfit." [ laughter ] "i'm ready, let's shoot. let's go, i'm ready." [ cheers and applause ] "camera ready!" well, here's another. senator brian schatz. his resolution is to, "run a a comb through his hair and say 'ay! whoa! ay!'" [ laughter ] next up, here's congressman chuck fleischmann. his solution is to, "stop eating gas station sushi." [ laughter ] [ gagging noises ] up next, here's congressman mike thompson. his resolution is to, "get his bullies stop calling him 'joe biden's luigi.'" [ laughter ] [ cheers and applause ] i have never heard of that one. here's another one. senator jon ossoff. his resolution is to, "book dinner reservations by telling everyone he's timothee chalamet." [ laughter ] next up, here's one from congressman michael guest. his resolution is to "return the souls he has stolen from children by appearing in their nightmares." appearances.title: U.S. House of Representatives U.S. House of Representatives : CSPAN : January 14, 2026 1:30pm-3:42pm EST
appearances.snippet: ann wagner. >> the house will come to order. please take your conversations off the floor. the house will come to order. for what purpose does the gentleman from oklahoma seek recognition? >> mr. speaker, i ask unanimous consent that all members have five legislative days to revise and extend their remarks and include extraneous material on h.r. 76, and that i may include and that i may include tabular material on the same. >> without objection. pursuant to house resolution 9092 and rule 18, the chair declares the house in the committee of the whole house on the state of the union for the consideration of h.r. 7006. the chair appoints the gentleman from illinois, mr. bost, to preside over the committee as a whole. doodles. >> house is in the committee of the whole house on the state of the union, for considering and consideration of h.r. 7006, which the clerk will report the by title. >> a bill making further consolidated appropriations for the fiscal year ending september 30th, 2026, and for other purposes. >> pursuant to the rule. the bill is considered read for the first

appearances.title: U.S. House of Representatives U.S. House of Representatives : CSPAN : January 12, 2026 3:00pm-6:09pm EST
appearances.snippet: and i want to thank congresswoman ann wagner for her leadership on this legislation, because it reflects a principle this body has long shared. when the justice system holds wrongdoers accountable, those resources should help rebuild the lives of innocent victims of the wrongdoers. congress created the crime victims fund through the victims of crime act of 1984 to support victims of violent crime through counseling, advocacy, and recovery services. importantly, this fund is financed by fines and penalties paid for by those convicted of federal crimes. it's not taxpayer dollars. that structure reflects that simple but powerful idea that accountability should serve justice. today, however, that promise is under strain. according to the office for victims of crime, the crime victims fund ended fiscal year 2024 with a balance of just $1.2 billion, a 90% decline since 2017. as a result, victim assistance programs nationwide face a $600 million funding shortfall for organizations serving survivors of domestic violence, child abuse and sexual assault, including programs across northeast texas w
